channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Airbnb Should Be a Sleeper Hit
item.description: Winter came early for the stock, but Airbnb is still outgrowing the industry, with new services offering potential upside.

item.title: I give my mother’s ailing next-door neighbor $500 a month. She agreed to sell me her house, although she’ll continue to live there. Is this a good plan?
item.description: “She has a next-door neighbor who is 72 and disabled, and has even more serious problems.”

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: ‘She said she wasn’t in love with me anymore’: I moved $700K to CDs and a safe-deposit box for my kids. Does my estranged wife have a right to these assets?
item.description: “After she moved out she said she wants 50% of the house when I sell.”

item.title: The Score: Nvidia, Super Micro Computer, Dollar General and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: ‘I have a dirty secret’: When I fly, I erase ‘basic economy’ on my ticket to skip the boarding line. My friend says it’s cheating. Who’s right?
item.description: “My friend says it’s cheating, as business passengers pay more money for early boarding.”

item.title: What Selloff? Stocks End August Higher After Head-Spinning Swings
item.description: U.S. stock indexes closed a tumultuous August with gains, riding a string of encouraging economic data to overcome concerns about the labor market.

item.title: ‘We shared all our assets prior to our marriage’: My husband inherited his parents’ home and didn’t put my name on the deed. What can I do?
item.description: “We have no wills at this point, and we live in California.”

item.title: Goldman Sachs to Lay Off Over 1,300 Workers
item.description: The layoffs are part of an annual review process that culls low performers.

item.title: Is the stock market open on Labor Day? Is Costco closed?
item.description: The September holiday is the last big hurrah of summer, but that also means many businesses and offices won’t be operating per usual.
